intro: Sternbergia caucasica, commonly known as the Caucasian primrose, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and delicate, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in late winter or early spring, producing clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
